name: senior Data engeneer

sections.description: In this section the questions will be releated to: SSIS, T-SQL, MS SQL Server

options.value: SSIS is used for managing user authentication.
SSIS is used for creating web applications.
SSIS is used for data migration, transformation, and designing complex ETL processes.

question.value: What is SSIS used for?

options.value: T-SQL is a programming language used for web development, emphasizing front-end design and user interface.
T-SQL is a version of SQL used in Oracle databases, focusing on data warehousing and analytics.
T-SQL is an extension of SQL in Microsoft SQL Server, emphasizing procedural programming, complex query writing, and transaction management.
T-SQL is a type of database management system that focuses on data visualization and reporting.

question.value: What is T-SQL and what does it emphasize?

sections.title: Business Intelligence Tools

sections.description: In this section the questions will be releated to: Data mining, Predictive analytics, Data quality assurance

options.value: Data mining is the method of manually sorting through data to find specific information without the use of technology.
Data mining is the process of discovering patterns and extracting information from large datasets using statistical analysis, machine learning, and database systems.
Data mining refers to the practice of storing data in physical archives for future reference.
Data mining is the process of creating new datasets from scratch using random data generation techniques.

question.value: What is data mining?

options.value: Graph traversal, dynamic programming, and network protocols.
Sorting, searching, and encryption algorithms.
Clustering, classification, regression, and association rule learning.
Image processing, audio compression, and video encoding.

Current trends and social media activity

VLOOKUP can handle unsorted lookup columns without any issues.

sections.title: Interpersonal/Transferable Skills

sections.description: In this section the questions will be releated to: Resource management, Project management, Team leadership

options.value: Maximizing resource waste to reduce costs.
Ignoring resource availability and focusing solely on profits.
Random distribution of resources without a clear plan.
Strategic allocation and utilization of resources to achieve organizational goals efficiently.

question.value: What does resource management involve?

options.value: Implementing a one-size-fits-all approach without adapting to project needs.
Focusing solely on individual tasks without considering team dynamics.
Prioritizing cost reduction over quality and stakeholder satisfaction.
Leading a team to achieve specific goals within time, budget, and scope constraints using methodologies like Agile and Waterfall.

question.value: What are the key components of project management?

options.value: Technical expertise in a specific field
Conflict resolution, emotional intelligence, and fostering a positive team culture.
Ability to work independently without collaboration
Strict adherence to rules and regulations
